Pre-Game Insights: Merrill Kelly will be a key factor for the D-backs, having thrived in the NL Division Series but faltering in Game 2 of the NLCS.
Aaron Nola has been excellent in October, with a 0.96 ERA in three starts, and has only allowed more than two earned runs in a start since Sept. 9.
Teams leading best-of-seven series, 3-2, with the remaining games at home have gone on to win 80% of the time.
The Phillies are 6-0 at home this postseason and have a strong chance of winning with Nola's performance.
Kyle Schwarber expressed confidence in the team's ability to win, saying 'We're ready to get back there. We're going to be ready. We're going to be prepared.'
The D-backs intend to keep their title hopes alive by winning Game 6 on Monday at Citizens Bank Park.
Torey Lovullo emphasized the importance of putting the team's performance on themselves, saying 'We have to put it on us, on our dugout, our clubhouse and just go and do the things that we do best.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies have a chance to clinch the NL pennant on their home turf for the second year in a row.
The D-backs have formed a formidable 1-2 punch at the top of the Arizona rotation with Merrill Kelly and Zac Gallen.
The Phillies' lineup remains the same as in previous games against right-handers, with Johan Rojas and Alec Bohm in their usual spots.
The D-backs' bullpen will be fully loaded for Game 6, and manager Torey Lovullo is expected to be aggressive in going to the bullpen.
Rhys Hoskins is on the 60-day injured list following left ACL surgery in March.
Dylan Covey is on the injured list with a lower-back injury.
Marte extended his postseason hitting streak to 14 games, the second-longest streak to start a postseason career.
Schwarber has hit five home runs in the NLCS, tying Chase Utley's five homers in the 2009 World Series for the most homers in a postseason series in franchise history.
Harper hit a homer in Game 5, his second homer of the series and fifth of the postseason.
Schwarber and Harper moved into a first-place tie with Jayson Werth for the most homers in Phillies postseason history (11).
